com.google.wave.api
Class AbstractRobot

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          com.google.wave.api.AbstractRobot
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventHandler, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public abstract class AbstractRobot
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
implements EventHandler

A robot is an automated participant on a wave, that can read the contents of a wave in which it participates, modify the wave's contents, add or remove participants, and create new blips and new waves. In short, a robot can perform many of the actions that any other participant can perform. This is the abstract base class for a Google Wave Java robot, that supports:

  • Automatic events deserialization and operations serialization, in the event based model
  • OAuth-secured operations submission, in the active model
  • Callback for profile request, including proxied/custom profile
  • Callback for capabilities.xml support
  • Callback for verification token request, that is used during the robot registration process, to obtain consumer key and secret
Robot should implements the handlers of the events that it's interested in, and specify the context and filter (if applicable) via the EventHandler.Capability annotation. For example, if it is interested in a BlipSubmittedEvent, and would like to get the parent blip with the incoming event bundle, then it should implement this method: 







See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail







submit


public java.util.List<JsonRpcResponse> submit(Wavelet wavelet,
                                              java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                                       throws java.io.IOException




Submits the pending operations associated with this Wavelet.











Parameters:
wavelet - the bundle that contains the operations to be submitted.
rpcServerUrl - the active gateway to send the operations to.

Returns:
a list of JsonRpcResponse that represents the responses
     from the server for all operations that were submitted.

Throws:

java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called prior to setting
     the proper consumer key, secret, and handler URL.

java.io.IOException - if there is a problem submitting the operations.










blindWavelet


public Wavelet blindWavelet(org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveId waveId,
                            org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveletId waveletId)




Returns an empty/blind stub of a wavelet with the given wave id and wavelet
 id.

 Call this method if you would like to apply wavelet-only operations
 without fetching the wave first.

 The returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the
 responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to
 the server, either by calling submit(Wavelet, String)
 or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet, to
 join its queue with another wavelet, for example, the event wavelet.











Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet.

Returns:
a stub of a wavelet.










blindWavelet


public Wavelet blindWavelet(org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveId waveId,
                            org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String proxyForId)




Returns an empty/blind stub of a wavelet with the given wave id and wavelet
 id.

 Call this method if you would like to apply wavelet-only operations
 without fetching the wave first.

 The returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the
 responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to
 the server, either by calling submit(Wavelet, String)
 or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet, to
 join its queue with another wavelet, for example, the event wavelet.











Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet.
proxyForId - the proxying information that should be set on the
     operation queue.

Returns:
a stub of a wavelet.










blindWavelet


public Wavelet blindWavelet(org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveId waveId,
                            org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String proxyForId,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Blip> blips)




Returns an empty/blind stub of a wavelet with the given wave id and wavelet
 id.

 Call this method if you would like to apply wavelet-only operations
 without fetching the wave first.

 The returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the
 responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to
 the server, either by calling submit(Wavelet, String)
 or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet, to
 join its queue with another wavelet, for example, the event wavelet.











Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet.
proxyForId - the proxying information that should be set on the
     operation queue.
blips - a collection of blips that belong to this wavelet.

Returns:
a stub of a wavelet.










newWave


public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants)




Creates a new wave with a list of participants on it.

 The root wavelet of the new wave is returned with its own
 OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure
 this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling
 submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling
 Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.











Parameters:
domain - the domain to create the wavelet on. In general, this should
     correspond to the domain of the incoming event wavelet, except when
     the robot is calling this method outside of an event or when the server
     is handling multiple domains.
participants - the initial participants on the wave. The robot, as the
     creator of the wave, will be added by default. The order of the
     participants will be preserved.










newWave


public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants,
                       java.lang.String proxyForId)




Creates a new wave with a list of participants on it.

 The root wavelet of the new wave is returned with its own
 OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure
 this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling
 submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling
 Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.











Parameters:
domain - the domain to create the wavelet on. In general, this should
     correspond to the domain of the incoming event wavelet, except when
     the robot is calling this method outside of an event or when the server
     is handling multiple domains.
participants - the initial participants on the wave. The robot, as the
     creator of the wave, will be added by default. The order of the
     participants will be preserved.
proxyForId - the proxy id that should be used to create the new wave.
     If specified, the creator of the wave would be
     robotid+@appspot.com.










newWave


public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants,
                       java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.String proxyForId)




Creates a new wave with a list of participants on it.

 The root wavelet of the new wave is returned with its own
 OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure
 this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling
 submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling
 Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.











Parameters:
domain - the domain to create the wavelet on. In general, this should
     correspond to the domain of the incoming event wavelet, except when
     the robot is calling this method outside of an event or when the server
     is handling multiple domains.
participants - the initial participants on the wave. The robot, as the
     creator of the wave, will be added by default. The order of the
     participants will be preserved.
msg - the message that will be passed back to the robot when
     WAVELET_CREATED event is fired as a result of this operation.
proxyForId - the proxy id that should be used to create the new wave.
     If specified, the creator of the wave would be
     robotid+@appspot.com.










newWave


public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants,
                       java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.String proxyForId,
                       java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                throws java.io.IOException




Creates a new wave with a list of participants on it.

 The root wavelet of the new wave is returned with its own
 OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure
 this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling
 submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling
 Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.











Parameters:
domain - the domain to create the wavelet on. In general, this should
     correspond to the domain of the incoming event wavelet, except when
     the robot is calling this method outside of an event or when the server
     is handling multiple domains.
participants - the initial participants on the wave. The robot, as the
     creator of the wave, will be added by default. The order of the
     participants will be preserved.
msg - the message that will be passed back to the robot when
     WAVELET_CREATED event is fired as a result of this operation.
proxyForId - the proxy id that should be used to create the new wave.
     If specified, the creator of the wave would be
     robotid+@appspot.com.
rpcServerUrl - if specified, this operation will be submitted
     immediately to this active gateway, that will return immediately the
     actual wave id, the id of the root wavelet, and id of the root blip.

Throws:

java.io.IOException - if there is a problem submitting the operation to the
      server, when submit is true.










fetchWavelet


public Wavelet fetchWavelet(org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveId waveId,
                            org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                     throws java.io.IOException




Fetches a wavelet using the active API.

 The returned wavelet contains a snapshot of the state of the wavelet at
 that point. It can be used to modify the wavelet, but the wavelet might
 change in between, so treat carefully.

 Also, the returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the
 responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to
 the server, either by calling submit(Wavelet, String)
 or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.











Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave to fetch.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet to fetch.
rpcServerUrl - the active gateway that is used to fetch the wavelet.

Throws:

java.io.IOException - if there is a problem fetching the wavelet.










fetchWavelet


public Wavelet fetchWavelet(org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveId waveId,
                            org.waveprotocol.wave.model.id.WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String proxyForId,
                            java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                     throws java.io.IOException




Fetches a wavelet using the active API.

 The returned wavelet contains a snapshot of the state of the wavelet at
 that point. It can be used to modify the wavelet, but the wavelet might
 change in between, so treat carefully.

 Also, the returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the
 responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to
 the server, either by calling submit(Wavelet, String)
 or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.











Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave to fetch.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet to fetch.
proxyForId - the proxy id that should be used to fetch this wavelet.
rpcServerUrl - the active gateway that is used to fetch the wavelet.

Throws:

java.io.IOException - if there is a problem fetching the wavelet.

setupVerificationToken


protected void setupVerificationToken(java.lang.String verificationToken,
                                      java.lang.String securityToken)




Sets up the verification token that is used for the owner verification
 step during the robot registration.











Parameters:
verificationToken - the verification token.
securityToken - the security token that should be matched against when
     serving a verification token request.










setupOAuth


protected void setupOAuth(java.lang.String consumerKey,
                          java.lang.String consumerSecret,
                          java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)




Sets the OAuth related properties, including the consumer key and secret
 that are used to sign the outgoing operations in the active mode. Robot
 developer needs to follow the registration process to obtain the key and
 secret:
 
    
   
  • http://wave.google.com/wave/robot/register - for wave preview
    • 
   
  • https://wave.google.com/a/wavesandbox.com/robot/register - for
       wave sandbox
    • 
 

 

 You can call this method multiple times to set up both preview and wave
 sandbox.
 

 After calling this method, the robot no longer accepts unsigned requests,
 but if you still want it, you can set
 setAllowUnsignedRequests(boolean) to true.











Parameters:
consumerKey - the consumer key.
consumerSecret - the consumer secret.
rpcServerUrl - the URL of the server that serves the JSON-RPC request.
     
    
       
  • http://www-opensocial.googleusercontent.com/api/rpc - for wave
           preview.
  • 
       
  • http://www-opensocial-sandbox.googleusercontent.com/api/rpc - for
           wave sandbox.
    • 
     


Throws:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments are null.










setupOAuth


protected void setupOAuth(java.lang.String consumerKey,
                          java.lang.String consumerSecret)




Sets the OAuth related properties, including the consumer key and secret
 that are used to sign the outgoing operations in the active mode. This
 method sets the JSON-RPC handler URL to http://gmodules.com/api/rpc,
 that is associated with wave preview instance.











Parameters:
consumerKey - the consumer key.
consumerSecret - the consumer secret.










setAllowUnsignedRequests


protected void setAllowUnsignedRequests(boolean allowUnsignedRequests)




Sets whether or not unsigned incoming requests from robot proxy are
 allowed.











Parameters:
allowUnsignedRequests - whether or not unsigned requests from robot
     proxy are allowed.










isUnsignedRequestsAllowed


protected boolean isUnsignedRequestsAllowed()













Returns:
true if unsigned incoming requests from robot proxy are
     allowed.










processEvents


protected void processEvents(EventMessageBundle events)




Processes the incoming event bundle. This method iterates over the event
 bundle and dispatch the individual event to its own handler, based on the
 event type.











Parameters:
events - the incoming event bundle.










computeCapabilityMap


protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,EventHandler.Capability> computeCapabilityMap()




Computes this robot's capabilities, based on the overriden event handler
 methods, and their EventHandler.Capability annotations.

 The result map does not use EventType enum as the key for stability
 between JVM runs, since the same enum may have different hashcode between
 JVM runs. This may cause two instances of the same robot that are running
 on different JVMs (for example, when App Engine scale the robot) to have
 different version number and capabilities ordering in
 capabilities.xml.












Returns:
a map of event type string to capability.
